@Michael Burrofato @Ethan Israel @Sanjay Meghani
@Salesforce @WaitingOnEngineer

Hi, we have 2 follow up questions:

	 - 	Is there a willingness to start over again with the AIC SQL DB?
	 - 	Could you please provide more detailed information on the steps which were taken during the stage where tables were dropped and then restored? Is it possible to get:

	 - 	A list of all the tables that were impacted
	 - 	More detail around if this process happened before/during/after the upgrade from 11.5 to 11.6. 
	 - 	Any information about the previous ticket you mentioned that resulted in these tables being dropped.

On Escalation Ticket # 00434149 the new comment has been added: - Is there a willingness to start over again with the AIC SQL DB?
No there are many reviews that exist and to remake them all is not an option. 

- Could you please provide more detailed information on the steps which were taken during the stage where tables were dropped and then restored? Is it possible to get:
So Long story short. old 11.5 install that was abandoned.
it had data from Several DC's some old some current.
Plan originally was to drop all tables that has significant data to free up space. Mostly FS tables
we went in circles with the Authentication table but ended up just reinstalling and manually setting up that access.
We tried to restore all AIC tables but had to reinstall to correct schema.


- A list of all the tables that were impacted  - 
Potentially relevant tables.
All tables starting with SA_FS
This table was removed when I filtered tables based on SP being in the name.
SA_AIC_ResourceReviewResponses
  


- More detail around if this process happened before/during/after the upgrade from 11.5 to 11.6. 
We upgraded. Then we went back to clean table data after the fact.


- Any information about the previous ticket you mentioned that resulted in these tables being dropped.
So Long story short. old 11.5 install that was abandoned
We upgraded. Then we went back to clean table data after the fact.
Originally didn't realize they wanted to retain AIC data so we dropped those tables a well.

On Escalation Ticket # 00434149 the new comment has been added: Current situation.
was able to restore AIC tables from backup - Should have restored all AIC tables but not FS tables.
After restoring the tables the client notices duplicate entries for resource owners. One of each duplicate is greyed out and unable to be removed.

SA_AIC_AuditEvents table went missing again

I don't understand what would delete the table.
can no longer login to the AIC. The original error is back:
"Unable to use the SQL Server Database provided"

Comparing the screenshot provided of the AIC tables with my Lab, only the SA_AIC_AuditEvents table is missing

you can see in the logs that she logged in successfully on 01/23 then on 01/24, it throws the error

uploaded the meeting recoding and timestamp .txt file
for escalation

On Escalation Ticket # 00434149 the new comment has been added: Hey Team, Thanks for Joining on the call today.
Customer has uploaded a spreadsheet to the sharepoint of the owners.

1. We fixed the AIC restart with Audit events table.
2. Going to look into a script for the Owners to get rid of duplicates.
3. Looking at the tables to determine the best or correct order to restore tables.

On Escalation Ticket # 00434149 the new comment has been added: Sanjay Meghani:

@Ethan Israel @Michael Burrofato @Helen Randall @WaitingOnEngineer

The provided table "SA_AIC_ResourceOwners" doesn't have any duplicate combination of resource and owner. I do remember when we joined SA_AIC_ResourceOwners table with the AD principal view it showed some duplicate data so my guess is there might be something wrong with AD tables. Can we run the following queries, and provide the result, please?


--- CODE ---
SELECT *
FROM SA_ADInventory_PrincipalsView
WHERE ObjectSId = 'S-1-5-21-1715567821-2025429265-1417001333-1809'
--- CODE ---

Or if you see any duplicate data in the view.


--- CODE ---
SELECT Value, count(*) 
FROM SA_AIC_Resources
GROUP BY Value
--- CODE ---

Also, can you export SA_AIC_Resources and SA_AIC_ResourceOptions tables to CSV and send them to us, please?

These are the tables related to reviews, you can try to restore them from your backup.

	 - 	SA_AIC_ResourceReviews
	 - 	SA_AIC_ResourceReviewData
	 - 	SA_AIC_ResourceReviewResponses
	 - 	SA_AIC_ResourceReviewResponseDetails
	 - 	SA_AIC_ResourceReviewTrusteeData
	 - 	SA_AIC_ResourceOptions

The table schema is changed in 11.6 so if your backup is from 11.5 then restoring wouldn't work. You can try setting the old schema version (2.0) to SA_AIC_SchemaCersion after restoring those tables and restarting the AIC service that will update the tables.

[DevOps CommentId:11686910]

@Ethan Israel @Michael Burrofato @Helen Randall @WaitingOnEngineer

So yes, there is duplicate data in the AD inventory principal view (as you can see in the pic1.png provided by the customer) and I suspect that other AD inventory tables might have duplicate data too. Can the engineer or customer verify this, please? By the way, I don't see any duplicates in the attached AIC tables.


** from pic1.png

Can the customer try dropping the AD Inventory tables and re-scan the AD environment, please?

On Escalation Ticket # 00434149 the new comment has been added: Good News. after Running the ADI drop tables job.
We reran ADI and everything is working.

Just curious, I get why the owners were no longer duplicated, but I am guessing the reviews aren't duplicated anymore due to the fact that the owners aren't?

Otherwise good to close.

On Escalation Ticket # 00434149 the new comment has been added: Sanjay Meghani:

@Ethan Israel @Michael Burrofato @Helen Randall  @WaitingOnEngineer

The AIC uses AD Inventory tables to pull user and group information and if there are no duplicate users or groups in the ADI table, the AIC shows owners and reviews correctly.

[DevOps CommentId:11714122]

On Escalation Ticket # 00434149 the new comment has been added: Spoke a little soon.

Just got this from the customer.

In trying to add new Groups for my next review cycle, I get the same sort of DB errors we saw before. Even a manual single add does not work. the GUI says, There was an error saving your changes.

2025-02-27 15:37:42 -- Error -- 172.16.146.39 HTTP/500 Request URL: https://vastaudit01.ifast-talk.com:481/v2/admins/data/owners/import/add: System.Data.SqlClient.SqlException (0x80131904): Cannot insert the value NULL into column 'ID', table 'StealthAudit.dbo.SA_AIC_Resources'; column does not allow nulls. INSERT fails.
The statement has been terminated.
